page.title: 03Farming.
page.content: The farms in this area range in size from about 30 acres to 500 acres and cover a range of enterprises, the most common being {milk production}for the Milk Marketing Board. The average size of the dairy herds is 50 cows. Several of the farms have a flock of{sheep, producing fat lambs for market in autumn. {Pigs} are the only enterprise on one farm but they are secondary production on 3 of the other farms. The dairy farms all produce{silage}as winter feed for their herds and 50% of the farms grow{corn,}mainly barley for home stock consumption. The remaining farm produces {beef} for sale at the local town marts. Calves are both home bred and bought in for this purpose. Each of the farms is owned and farmed by the same family with one exception -Colpitts Grange, where a manager has been employed.
